2011b4d6-25b3-46a5-b139-19c99695a412.description: Associates complete a thorough & comprehensive education on the Life Science Industry. This includes the evolution, competitive landscape, key industry & talent trends. This experiential & proprietary learning covers industry spotlights for Consumer Healthcare, Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology & Medical Devices. Team members are enabled with knowledge & service expectations that directly relate to the business needs of our clients, thereby enhancing candidate interactions & overall execution.
2011b4d6-25b3-46a5-b139-19c99695a412.name: Life Sciences Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Life Sciences PMO & Industry Overview - Delivered through leadership engagement, reinforcement of purpose, vision and specialization. Overview of the Life Sciences industry including competitive landscape, geographic footprint, key sector overviews, market trends, talent trends and Korn Ferry expectations.

Industry Spotlights: Individual breakdowns of the key sectors including Consumer Healthcare, Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology and Medical Devices. Each includes content and associated learning validation.
Supplemental reinforcement sessions to drive key learnings, and content adoption to support position growth and career agility.

c2c91f99-5205-474d-a590-d12a99bfdcbd.description: Recruiters complete a position-specific learning path focusing on enhancing their recruitment delivery & execution skills. The curriculum reinforces & guides expectations for candidate & client care, communication & solidifies the "Korn Ferry way". This learning path is engaging featuring a mix of virtual instructor led classes, e-learnings & reinforcements resulting in ability to accurately analyze job requirements, design & promote sourcing solutions, & elevate to a consultative partner.
c2c91f99-5205-474d-a590-d12a99bfdcbd.name: KF Recruiter

badge_template_activities.title: KF START: Delivers content around Korn Ferry's business mix, evolution, values and differentiators. Participants gain access to and become familiar with the key tools and resources to perform, communicate and network with colleagues. - 16 hours

KF CORE: Combines content covering the foundational skills and expectations for client delivery within Korn Ferry’s RPO & Projects business including the foundational elements of inclusive hiring practices. Examples include: Recruitment process skills, Korn Ferry IP, and DE&I - 10.5 hours

KF SKILL: Provides a set of courses aimed at developing and fine-tuning behaviors, skills and communication. These courses set a foundation, sharpen approach, elevate consultative engagement and can be a building block to set employees on a path for ongoing development through an expansive course offering. Examples include: Sourcing Strategies, Communication Skills, Behavioral Interviewing, Consultative dialogue, and Handling objections. - 21 hours

KF CLIENT: Validation of the knowledge that must be achieved in order to deliver for our clients. Including understanding client-specific performance expectations, process expectations, their value proposition and talent strategy.

1f6b6318-9d6c-4633-a155-d926b8ce0a63.description: Associate Recruiters complete a position-specific learning path focusing on enhancing their strategic sourcing & execution skills. The curriculum reinforces & guides expectations for candidate & client care, communication & solidifies the "Korn Ferry way". This learning path is a mix of virtual instructor led classes, e-learnings & reinforcements resulting in enhanced ability to accurately analyze job requirements, design & promote sourcing solutions & how to effectively balance stakeholders.
1f6b6318-9d6c-4633-a155-d926b8ce0a63.name: KF Associate Recruiter

badge_template_activities.title: KF START: Delivers content around Korn Ferry's business mix, evolution, values, and differentiators. Participants gain access to and become familiar with the key tools and resources to perform, communicate, and network with colleagues. - 16 hours

KF CORE: Combines content covering the foundational skills and expectations for client delivery within Korn Ferry’s RPO & Projects business including the foundational elements of inclusive hiring practices. Examples include: Recruitment process skills, Korn Ferry IP, and DE&I - 10.5 hours

KF SKILL: Provides a set of courses aimed at developing and fine-tuning behaviors, skills and communication. These courses set a foundation, sharpen approach, elevate consultative engagement and can be a building block to set employees on a path for ongoing development through an expansive course offering. Examples include: Sourcing Strategies, Communication Skills and Handling objections. - 21 hours

KF CLIENT: Validation of the knowledge that must be achieved in order to deliver for our clients. Including understanding client-specific performance expectations, process expectations, their value proposition and talent strategy.

bdf78724-2f9f-4a45-a9ab-e73587a44b65.description: Coordinators complete a position-specific learning path focusing on enhancing their tactical & soft skills. The curriculum reinforces & guides expectations for candidate care, communication, time management & solidifies the "Korn Ferry way". This learning path is engaging featuring a mix of virtual instructor led classes, e-learnings & reinforcements resulting in enhanced ability to effectively manage & engage with candidates & stakeholders during the stages of the recruitment process.
bdf78724-2f9f-4a45-a9ab-e73587a44b65.name: KF Coordinator

badge_template_activities.title: KF START: Delivers content around Korn Ferry's business mix, evolution, values and differentiators. Participants gain access to and become familiar with the key tools and resources to perform, communicate, and network with colleagues. - 16 hours

KF CORE: Combines content covering the foundational skills and expectations for client delivery within Korn Ferry’s RPO & Projects business including the foundational elements of inclusive hiring practices. Examples include: Recruitment process skills, Korn Ferry IP, and DE&I - 8 hours

KF SKILL: Provides a set of courses aimed at developing and fine-tuning behaviors, skills and communication. These courses set a foundation, sharpen approach, elevate consultative engagement and can be a building block to set employees on a path for ongoing development through an expansive course offering. Examples include: Candidate management, Outreach, Communication Skills, and Conflict Resolution. - 14 hours

KF CLIENT: Validation of the knowledge that must be achieved in order to deliver for our clients. Including understanding client-specific performance expectations, process expectations, their value proposition and talent strategy.

b9d09aac-e8b3-4e5b-9916-676862b1463a.description: Generalist Recruiters complete an intensive curriculum to increase their knowledge of the technical landscape including the organizational structure, skill classifications, role qualifications, identifiers & terminology. This experiential learning results in the ability to research technical market insights, conduct meaningful engagement with technical talent & informed consultation with stakeholders. Content is current & scenario-based facilitated by top performing Technical Recruiters.
b9d09aac-e8b3-4e5b-9916-676862b1463a.name: Tech Academy

badge_template_activities.title: Technology Fundamentals - Overview of the function of the IT Department broken down by divisions. Common roles within the core functions of IT. Introduction to software methodologies and the technical stack. - Virtual Sessions - 1 hour

Technical Classifications - Overview of technical topic, definitions, common roles, talent attraction methodologies, market drivers, skillsets and where to go for additional information. - Virtual Sessions - 6 hours
Technical Sourcing - Deep dive into sourcing strategies, market data, creating insights, market mapping and tool - Virtual Sessions - 4 hours
Process Elevated - Technical Differentiations - Recruitment stages with best practices and technical differentiations - Virtual Sessions - 11 hours

Process Elevated - Technical Differentiations - Preparation and practical application of recruitment stages with an appointed technical recruitment subject matter expert to evaluate and provide coaching - Virtual Sessions - 12 hours

Reinforcement Sessions - Additional course work on current trends and latest attraction techniques to include but are not limited to: sourcing strategies, DE&I, industry trends, and scenario based exercises - Virtual Sessions - 5 hours

Capstone - Present and demonstrate a deep understanding of an application, concept or process differentiator related to the technical space. Must be based on a relevant executed solution. - Virtual Presentation - 5 hours

db78ac58-545a-4a9e-b70d-75eed06e1f3d.description: Participants explore new mindsets designed to help them manage their team and personal performance in complex work environments. Introduces new approaches for employee recognition, setting expectations, providing constructive feedback, and communication that encourages engagement and motivation. Focuses on strategies for team collaboration and how to guide the team to adapt with ease. Additionally, provides new skills for concise and compelling communication that lead to results.
db78ac58-545a-4a9e-b70d-75eed06e1f3d.name: Team Leader - KFD Internal Development

badge_template_activities.title: Building Trust Under Pressure - eLearning - 1 Hour
Offering Rewards and Recognition - eLearning - 1 Hour
Shaping a Motivational Workplace - eLearning - 1 Hour
Clarifying Performance Expectations - eLearning - 1 Hour
Adapting to Constant Change - Virtual Classroom - 2 Hours
Influencing Outcomes Through Others - Virtual Classroom - 2 Hours
Correcting Performance Problems - eLearning - 1 Hour
Giving Needs-Based Feedback - eLearning - 1 hour
Developing Team Agility - Virtual Classroom - 2 Hours

13f75ef2-9eda-441c-a4a6-02175a471dde.description: The Korn Ferry learning program for Managers provides a plan to develop the skills and capabilities to become successful and impactful managers at Korn Ferry. Content contained within the learning path centers around 5 key areas: self-development​​​​​​​, people management, client management, commercial acumen and corporate expectations. These areas are essential for performing and delivering for our clients and provide a framework to support and develop Managers and the people they lead.
13f75ef2-9eda-441c-a4a6-02175a471dde.name: KF Manager

badge_template_activities.title: KF START: Delivers content around Korn Ferry's business mix, evolution, values and differentiators. Participants gain access to and become familiar with the key tools and resources to perform, communicate and network with colleagues. - Varies by tenure

KF CORE FOR MANAGERS: Combines content covering the skills and expectations for client delivery and managing people within Korn Ferry’s RPO & Projects business. Examples include: Your Leadership Aspirations, Understanding Yourself and Your Team, Fundamentals of Effective Feedback, and Cultural Dexterity. - 18 hours

KF SKILL FOR MANAGERS: Provides a set of courses aimed at developing and fine-tuning behaviors, skills and communication. These courses set a foundation, sharpen approach, elevate consultative engagement and can be a building block to set employees on a path for ongoing development through an expansive course offering. Examples include: Leading Virtually in Disruptive Times and Influencing Skills. - 9 hours

KF CLIENT: Validation of the knowledge that must be achieved in order to deliver for and develop our clients. This includes understanding client-specific performance expectations, process expectations, their value proposition and talent strategy and ensuring your team understands these expectations. - Hours vary by engagement

80dc03d8-f5c0-4b09-887f-5383f63d48b7.description: Focus on fundamental project management skills, concepts and techniques, including controlling multiple risks using concise strategies. In addition, learn how to adapt your communication style for greater impact, apply different types of thinking for improved analysis and problem solving, and learn the philosophy, values, and principles of Lean and Agile.
80dc03d8-f5c0-4b09-887f-5383f63d48b7.name: Foundational Project Management - KFD Internal Development

Fundamentals of Lean and Agile - eLearning - 7.5 hours
High-Impact Communication - Virtual Classroom - 3 days/22.5 hours
Risk Management - eLearning - 22.5 hours

d9d40402-b552-4a03-8463-2b1a3aef8482.description: This program has been designed to enhance the capabilities and skills related to Korn Ferry Employees with high levels of Subject Manager knowledge and several years of maturity in handling complex client needs. This program is designed to help our SMEs lead people and teams through complex conversation, foster participation across those whom they are engaged in, and enable people to adapt to shifting priorities and change.
d9d40402-b552-4a03-8463-2b1a3aef8482.name: Senior SME - KFD Internal Developement

badge_template_activities.title: Adapting to Constant Change - Virtual Classroom - 2 Hours (Optional)
Building Trust Under Pressure - eLearning - 2 Hours
Managing Your Priorities - Virtual Classroom - 3 Hours (Optional)
Making Collaborative Decisions - Virtual Classroom - 3 Hours (Optional)
Guiding Collaborative Discussions - Virtual Classroom - 3 Hours (Optional)
Skillful Conversations - Virtual Classroom - 3 Hours (Optional)
Influencing Without Authority - eLearning - 20 Hours

5833dbf1-54b4-4299-9f80-c72d9d9ee76a.description: This program has been developed to increase capability and behaviors for our global shared delivery and client services teams. With a core focus on coaching team members to build a culture of client first behavior and developing a customer centric approach to solutioning client issues.
5833dbf1-54b4-4299-9f80-c72d9d9ee76a.name: SDC and Customer Service - KFD Internal Development

badge_template_activities.title: Service Ready Core - eLearning - 18 Hours
Coaching to be Service Ready - eLearning - 20 Hours (Optional)

d567d7ee-0994-4d21-9274-af208c268f65.description: This program is designed to shift behavior, thinking and leadership of Korn Ferry's most experienced and future leaders. The program will prepare them for heightened pressure, challenges, experiences, and how to thrive in a work place where change and ambiguity are common place. It will support them to lead from the front, equip themselves with new ways to communicate to their teams and stakeholders and prepare them for future career opportunities.
d567d7ee-0994-4d21-9274-af208c268f65.name: Senior Leader - KFD Internal Development

Building Effective Teams - eLearning - 21 Hours

baca525c-b181-4504-9ebe-8232c46ad324.description: This program has been developed to increase capability and behaviors for our global technical support teams. With a core focus on coaching team members to build a culture of client first behavior. The program will assist with the developing a customer centric approach to solutioning client issues, improving customer interactions, ensuring that issues are resolved in a timely and satisfactory way.
baca525c-b181-4504-9ebe-8232c46ad324.name: Global Support (Coaching to Be Service Ready) - KFD Internal Development

d5f60938-9267-4d21-af32-03d8bc7bb02d.description: Become more proficient in core project management skills, including; converting requirements into complete, coherent, and organized requirements documentation, predicting project costs and work time, leading project teams through more effective communication, identifying contract components and managing a contract lifecycle, developing an efficient and effective methodology for conducting a negotiation, and finally, building credibility, resolving performance challenges, and building networks.
d5f60938-9267-4d21-af32-03d8bc7bb02d.name: Intermediate Project Management - KFD Internal Development

Influencing Without Authority - eLearning - 20 hours

4eaabb3d-9001-485c-8d29-dce52fb2ee3f.description: This six-month, interactive leadership development program is designed to help mid-level professionals strengthen their leadership skills and become empowered to accomplish their career goals. Through live virtual classes, personal coaching, self-guided learning, and peer interactions, participants will better understand their leadership profile and how to activate their leadership potential.
4eaabb3d-9001-485c-8d29-dce52fb2ee3f.name: Leadership U for Humanity Completion

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Korn Ferry's Assessment of Leadership Potential
Complete 6 Power of Choice live virtual classroom sessions (2-hours per session)
Complete 6 Leadership U live virtual classroom sessions (1-hour per session)
Complete 6 executive career coaching sessions

369d2b92-a091-40a9-99f0-d8b9da5e34ca.description: This program has been designed to support the development of those within Client Success at Korn Ferry. The coursework connects learning assets that support understanding our clients, thinking about how to drive results and outcomes, plus understanding how KF Methodology increases organizational performance. This program will really help our experienced Client Advocacy professionals to stand in the shoes of our clients and walk the journey of change and partnership with them.
369d2b92-a091-40a9-99f0-d8b9da5e34ca.name: Client Advocacy - KFD Internal Development

Conceptual Selling With Perspective - eLearning - 3 Hours

660acbf8-6f77-448e-80e7-34afb754b69e.description: These dynamic badge earners have served at least one year on Korn Ferry’s Colleague Advisory Council. Members offer perspective and advise executive leadership on their workplace experiences – helping to inform decisions and shape opportunities to support the work we do for our clients and the development and support we offer our colleagues around the globe.
660acbf8-6f77-448e-80e7-34afb754b69e.name: Korn Ferry Colleague Advisory Council

badge_template_activities.title: Members play important roles in providing input to ensure that we provide our clients and colleagues meaningful and relevant experiences reflective of our purpose, vision and values. Advisory members share their experiences, offer perspectives, facilitate connections, and enrich our ways of working. Members participate in meetings and actively engage in the community group activities.

skills.name: Problem Assessment, Solving and Critical Thinking
